page.title: 04Warehouses in Parker Avenue
page.content: Behind the Walton Container Terminal there are some new roads in which firms connected with the dock have set up. Some are transport firms and some store containers. In Parker Avenue there are some very large warehouses. Two of these are "bonded" warehouses in which goods which have not paid customs duty are stored. At least one very large warehouse has been taken over as an intervention store for holding some of the "grain mountain" which the European Economic Community has built up. Farmers are paid for the grain they produce even if it is not needed.149,000 tonnes are stored in Felixstowe at the moment. Some grain grown in Trimley last year was taken straight into store. Many people would rather send food to the hungry elsewhere rather than keep it.
